basics.summary: Doctoral researcher at CÂ²DH with a multidisciplinary background in political science, history, and digital humanities. Experienced in archival research, historical data analysis, and computational tools. Passionate about the cultural significance of code and digital artifacts as historical sources.

work.name: Swiss Federal Institute of Technology Lausanne (EPFL)
work.summary: Worked on the Lausanne Time Machine project at EPFL, correcting OCR and HTR digitization of 19th-century cadastral records for the State of Vaud, ensuring accuracy by cross-referencing software output with historical sources.

work.name: Fribourg State Court
work.summary: Organized and enriched the classification plan of judicial archives, contributed to public historical notices for an exhibition, and cross-referenced photos with archival maps.

work.name: University of Zurich
work.summary: Supported the FNS project 'Measuring Economic Growth and Welfare in 19th Century Switzerland' by consulting archival records, extracting historical economic data, and designing data collection templates.

work.name: Swiss Elite Observatory â€“ University of Lausanne
work.summary: Researched and inputted biographical data on Swiss elites from the 20th and 21st centuries into the project's structured database.

work.name: PrEP School â€“ Lausanne
work.summary: Prepared students for university entrance exams; led workshops on constitutional law; compiled answers to exam questions for Switzerland, France, England, and the US.
